definition: to close a country/to exclude foreign contact/closed country (Qing China, North Korea etc)
old variant of 鎖|锁[suo3]
to lock up/to lock/lock/CL:把[ba3]
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact

sentences.english: The closed-door policy of the Qing dynasty closed people's visions and minds.
sentences.chinese: 闭关锁国政策封禁了人们的眼界和思想。

sentences.english: The ancient civilization became a byword for isolation and stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 闭关锁国，停滞不前成了这个文明古国的代名词。

sentences.english: No country can develop healthily with its door closed.
sentences.chinese: 闭关锁国，任何一个国家都不能健康的发展。

sentences.english: Yet these advantages could all be frittered away if the nation were to close its borders.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们闭关锁国，排斥移民，这些优势将荡然无存。

sentences.english: Turkmenistan's shackling is typical of broader failure in the region.
sentences.chinese: 土库曼斯坦的闭关锁国是这个区域更大的失败。

sentences.english: He proceeds to shut Japan off from the rest of the world, something his successors continue for 250 years.
sentences.chinese: 他从闭关锁国中获益，他的继承人延续到250年后。

sentences.english: When we closed our doors, you launched the Opium War to open our markets.
sentences.chinese: 曾经我们闭关锁国，你发动鸦片战争撞开我们的大门。

sentences.english: Led to a closed-door policy of China to start small-scale peasant .
sentences.chinese: 导致了中国走向了闭关锁国的小农经济的开始。

definition: to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact
close the country to international intercourse
closed-door policy
prohibition on entering or leaving by sea
the Japanese Meiji Restoration of 1868
the Great Powers (history)
to abandon the old (Asian) ways and learn from Europe/refers to the ideas that led to the Meiji Restoration and Japan's subsequent colonization projects in Asia
the Opium Wars of 1840-1842 and 1860-1861
semicolonial
open door policy/Egyptian President Sadat's infitah policy towards investment and relations with Israel
to abolish the feudal Han and introduce modern prefectures (refers to reorganization during Meiji Japan)
having trading relations (of nations or regions)
Celestial Empire, tributary title conferred on imperial China/Taiping Heavenly Kingdom
Ryūkyū kingdom 1429-1879 (on modern Okinawa)
Qing government (1644-1911)

lit. rich country, strong army (idiom); slogan of legalist philosophers in pre-Han times/Make the country wealthy and the military powerful, slogan of modernizers in Qing China and Meiji Japan (Japanese pronunciation: Fukoku kyōhei)
